intro: Tripogandra elata, commonly known as the tall tripogandra, is a perennial herb native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of up to 1.5 meters, with slender, branched stems and finely divided leaves. Its small, yellowish-green flowers appear in umbels, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. Tripogandra elata is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
